results.title: Life in Ancient Greece: home and education
results.brief_description: Pictures the activities of a typical family living in Athens, Greece in 400 BC. Studies manner of dress, religion, education, and in particular a pottery factory through using a story about a young boy and a vase. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.title_for_label: Life in Ancient Greece: home and education

results.title: Life in an oasis: North Africa
results.brief_description: Shows life in the productive areas of the Nile Valley which are called the Nile Oasis. Explores the desert wasteland and the Sahara. Typical camel caravan illustrates the hardships of transportation. Date palm trees, mud brick houses, and small schools are shown. Last section shows development if sterile land into a new oasis, and the problems faced by the inhabitants of an arid area where irrigation is difficult.

results.title: Life in an aquarium
results.brief_description: Setting up, stocking and maintaining a class-room aquarium. Explains how fish breathe under water, and illustrates the difference between lungs and gills; how fish use their tails and fins for locomotion; the stages in the development of the frog from the tadpole; and how water snails move about and protect themselves. Designed to implement the science curriculum of the lower elementary grades.

results.title: Life in a tin = Vita in scatola
results.brief_description: Bozzetto’s satirical cartoon about the repetitious humdrum life of the average human being. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Life in a pond
results.brief_description: Illustrates pond life in action, providing examples of important principals of natural science. Shows in microscopic and underwater scenes the variety of self-sustaining plants and animals found in a typical fresh water pond, among them the shoreward, floating, and submerges green plants and water fleas, beetles, insect larvae, dragonfly nymphs, and minnows.

results.title: Life in a fishing village
results.brief_description: Scenes in the harbour and town of Gravarna, a fishing village on the west coast of Sweden, with emphasis on the importance of the fishing fleet to the activities of the entire village, and the part played by this community in the European fishing industry. Follows a young boy at school, at work and at play.

results.title: Life in a drop of water
results.brief_description: Presents, by means of microcinematography, the fundamental life processes of nutrition, locomotion, reaction, and reproduction of the simplest plant and animal forms - the algae, amoeba, spirogyra, vulvox, paramecia, botacella, stentor, hydra and various rotapers.

results.title: Life history of the mosquito aedes aegypti: carrier of yellow fever

results.title: Life goes on
results.creator_credit: John Furse, Melrose Productions and Angela Pope
results.brief_description: Tells the story of Peggy and George, an elderly couple, who retire with what they think is a reasonable income. But a few years later inflation has taken its toll and they find themselves short of money.
